citation.article-title: Description of Persicirhabdus sediminis gen. nov., sp. nov., Roseibacillus ishigakijimensis gen. nov., sp. nov., Roseibacillus ponti sp. nov., Roseibacillus persicicus sp. nov., Luteolibacter pohnpeiensis gen. nov., sp. nov. and Luteolibacter algae sp. nov., six marine members of the phylum 'Verrucomicrobia', and emended descriptions of the class Verrucomicrobiae, the order Verrucomicrobiales and the family Verrucomicrobiaceae.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Luteolibacter (Lu.te.o.li.bac′ter. L. adj. luteolus pale yellow; N.L. masc. n. bacter from Gr. neut. n. baktron rod; N.L. masc. n. Luteolibacter a pale-yellow-coloured rod).
Cells lack flagella and are non-motile.
The major respiratory quinone is MK-9.
The G+C contents of the genomic DNA of known strains are around 55 mol%.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are C16 : 0 and iso-C14 : 0.
The type species is Luteolibacter pohnpeiensis.
